item.title: Interactive and reproducible research
item.description: Modern assay techniques have transformed biology into a data-rich science, and a fundamental component in the workflow of almost each scientific effort is represented by computational analyses. High-throughput sequencing applied to quantification of gene expression (RNA-sequencing) delivers at the same time an overview as well as plenty of details about the complex organization and regulation of transcriptome profiles for a set of biological samples. This high-dimensional assay, currently performed routinely by many research groups at the CTH, is, however, of little use without efficient biostatistics and bioinformatics methods to preprocess, analyze, and properly interpret them.

item.title: Plateletopedia
item.description: Continuing to build upon the framework I developed in my doctoral studies (Marini and Binder, 2016), my objective is to design and develop a combination of methods, software, and resources, focused on the field of gene regulation in platelets. I will leverage on the many existing platelets RNA-Seq datasets (either published or generated in-house) to assemble a common resource that will be seamlessly used by thrombosis and hemostasis researchers to integrate the available corpus of known transcriptomic profiles with own data.
